ai-iti69:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti69:2.1_0: “Whoever has not given up greed, hate, and delusion
ai-iti69:2.2_0: is said to have not crossed over the ocean with its waves and whirlpools, its sharks and monsters.
ai-iti69:2.3_0: Whoever has given up greed, hate, and delusion
ai-iti69:2.4_0: is said to have crossed over the ocean with its waves and whirlpools, its sharks and monsters. Crossed over and gone beyond, that brahmin stands on the shore.”
ai-iti69:3.3_0: have crossed the ocean so hard to cross,
ai-iti69:3.4_0: with its sharks and monsters, its waves and dangers.
ai-iti69:4.1_0: They’ve escaped their chains, given up death, and have no attachments.
ai-iti69:4.2_0: Painful, the suffering that leads to future lives.
ai-iti69:4.3_0: They’ve come to an end, and cannot be measured;
ai-iti69:4.4_0: and they’ve confounded the King of Death, I say.”
ai-iti69:5.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
ai-iti69:6.4_0: Furthermore, they speak for the second time.
